August 20, 2020

Dear WCS Community,

At their meeting last night, the WCS Board of Education approved a Return to School Plan that has all students starting school in a Remote Learning environment on Tuesday, September 8, 2020.

Visit wcskids.net to read my letter to the community that includes frequently asked questions, information on parent training for Schoology, our online platform, and a Technology Request Survey regarding access to a laptop computer for use at home.

Most important, we recognize the challenge this will be for families and will do our very best to provide support as we all work toward a return to in-person learning. I appreciate your understanding and support as the safety and well-being of our students and staff are our highest priority.

Please continue to be safe, stay healthy, and visit wcskids.net for updates.

Sincerely,
Robert D. Livernois, Ph.D.
Superintendent

The 7th grade students in Ms. Rawaa Yaldo's ELA class at Grissom Middle School were thrilled to welcome Philadelphia Eagles defensive end Mr. Brandon Graham to their weekly virtual class meeting.

Mr. Graham was set to visit Ms. Yaldo's classroom in March, but due to Covid-19, he was unable able to speak to students in person. Mr. Graham encouraged students to stay in school and graduate college. He answered questions in regards to the negative impact of social media on teens and reiterated the importance of hard work and resilience. He shared some personal stories, from growing up in the city of Detroit to almost giving up on his football dreams as a teen.

Mr. Graham is sending the students Philadelphia Eagles lanyards and sunglasses in time for summer break. #wcskids #dyanmicfutures

May 1st is School Lunch Hero Day! WCS would like to salute all of our nutrition services professionals for their hard work and dedication to our students and the community.

Our nutrition staff strive to make lunchtime a favorite part of every student’s day. From their friendly greetings in the cafeteria and the love they dish out with every student’s meal, to how they encourage kids to eat more fruits and vegetables, our school nutrition professionals are truly heroes.

Between preparing healthy meals, adhering to strict nutrition standards, navigating student food allergies, and offering service with a smile, WCS nutrition professionals have a lot on their plate.

Recently, our nutrition services staff has been working hard preparing more than 50,000 meals a week for distribution to our community during the coronavirus pandemic.

WCS appreciates the women and men of our nutrition services department! #SchoolLunchHeroes #wcskids

Students in Ms. Karen McLaughlin’s World of Fours class at Holden Elementary are continuing to learn at home, thanks in part to a $1,000 Keeping Kids Learning grant sponsored by Donors Choose. The pilot program is geared toward getting resources to kids as quickly as possible during school closures.

Ms. McLaughlin and her family delivered tote bags consisting of basic school supplies, books, and other hands-on manipulatives, to her students so they could continue remote learning. Ms. McLaughlin also received a generous donation of books and supplies from the MISD to distribute to her students.

Our Holden families were extremely appreciative and the students couldn’t wait to show Ms. McLaughlin all their learning supplies during a virtual class session.
